data.name: ColPickerTip
data.value: Click the image on the left or type the hex below to pick a color

data.name: SetHexButton
data.comment: Click to set a hex color

data.name: VectorImagePreviewWidth
data.comment: The height changes according to the image aspect ratio

data.name: HM_OriginalAspectRatio
data.comment: Keep the ratio of original image

data.name: CS_ExportingFolder
data.value: Export successful! Click to open the folder

data.name: CM_PCA
data.value: PCA Principal Component (Good for few colors)

data.name: CM_KMeansPP_ToolTip
data.value: KMeans++ clustering with improved initial point selection for more stable clustering results.

data.name: CM_WpfMedianCut_ToolTip
data.value: WPF's built-in median cut algorithm, fast and suitable for simple scenarios.

data.name: CM_WpfKMeans_ToolTip
data.value: [Has randomness] Uses WPF median cut first, then K-Means for refinement, balancing speed and quality.

data.name: CM_KMPlusKM_Recommended_ToolTip
data.value: [Has randomness] KMeans++ initialization + KMeans clustering, improves clustering quality.

data.name: CM_Popularity_ToolTip
data.value: Selects dominant colors by frequency of appearance, simple and efficient.

data.name: CM_Octree_ToolTip
data.value: Octree space partitioning, suitable for images with sparse color distribution.

data.name: CM_VarianceSplit_ToolTip
data.value: Splits along the direction of maximum color variance, highlighting dominant colors.

data.name: CM_PCA_ToolTip
data.value: Principal component analysis, extracts the main direction of color distribution.

data.name: CM_MinMaxKM_ToolTip
data.value: Min-max distance method combined with KMeans++, improves clustering diversity.

data.name: CM_NativeKM_ToolTip
data.value: Arduano's native KMeans algorithm, the same algorithm used in the original ImageToMidi.

data.name: CM_MeanShift_ToolTip
data.value: Mean shift clustering, no need to specify cluster count, suitable for complex distributions.

data.name: CM_DBSCAN_ToolTip
data.value: Density-based clustering that can discover arbitrarily shaped clusters.

data.name: CM_GMM_ToolTip
data.value: Gaussian mixture model, suitable for images with multi-Gaussian color distributions.

data.name: CM_Hierarchical_ToolTip
data.value: Bottom-up cluster merging, forming hierarchical structures.

data.name: CM_Spectral_ToolTip
data.value: Graph theory-based clustering method, suitable for complex structures.

data.name: CM_LabKMeans_ToolTip
data.value: KMeans clustering in Lab color space, more consistent with human visual perception.

data.name: CM_FloydSteinberg_ToolTip
data.value: Classic error diffusion dithering algorithm, improves color representation.

data.name: CM_OrderedDither_ToolTip
data.value: Ordered dithering using Bayer matrix, suitable for low color depth displays.

data.name: CM_OPTICS_ToolTip
data.value: Density-based clustering algorithm that can discover cluster structures of different densities.

data.name: CM_FixedBitPalette_ToolTip
data.value: Uses fixed palette, up to 256 colors.

data.name: PP_MaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 20000~50000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are more accurate but slower.

data.name: PP_Seed_ToolTip
data.value: Random seed for clustering initialization. Integer. 0 for automatic random, other values can reproduce results.

data.name: PP_MaxIterations_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum KMeans iterations. Integer. Recommended 50~200. Lower values may not converge, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_Threshold_ToolTip
data.value: Convergence threshold for clustering. Decimal. Recommended 0.1~5. Lower values are more accurate but slower, higher values are faster but less precise.

data.name: PP_MaxLevel_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum octree level. Integer. Recommended 6~8. Lower values are faster but with low color resolution, higher values are more detailed but slower.

data.name: PP_OctreeMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum pixel samples for octree. Integer. Recommended 20000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_VarianceSplitMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 20000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are more accurate but slower.

data.name: PP_PowerIterations_ToolTip
data.value: Number of power iterations for PCA principal component analysis. Integer. Recommended 10~30. Lower values are faster but less accurate principal components, higher values are more accurate but slower.

data.name: PP_PcaMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum pixel samples for PCA. Integer. Recommended 20000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_KMeansIters_ToolTip
data.value: Number of KMeans clustering iterations. Integer. Recommended 3~10. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are more accurate but slower.

data.name: PP_WeightedMaxMinMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 20000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_Iterations_ToolTip
data.value: Number of KMeans clustering iterations. Integer. Recommended 5~20. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are more accurate but slower.

data.name: PP_Rate_ToolTip
data.value: Convergence rate for KMeans clustering. Decimal. Recommended 0.1~0.5. Lower values converge slower but more stable, higher values converge faster but may be unstable.

data.name: PP_Bandwidth_ToolTip
data.value: Bandwidth parameter for mean shift. Decimal. Recommended 16~64. Lower values produce finer clustering, higher values produce coarser clustering.

data.name: PP_MeanShiftMaxIter_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum iterations for mean shift. Integer. Recommended 5~20. Lower values may not converge, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_MeanShiftMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 10000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_Epsilon_ToolTip
data.value: Neighborhood radius for DBSCAN clustering. Decimal. Recommended 1~10. Lower values produce finer clustering, higher values produce coarser clustering.

data.name: PP_MinPts_ToolTip
data.value: Minimum points for DBSCAN clustering. Integer. Recommended 3~10. Lower values make it easier to form small clusters, higher values make it harder to form clusters.

data.name: PP_DBSCANMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 2000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_GMMMaxIter_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum iterations for Gaussian mixture model. Integer. Recommended 10~50. Lower values are faster but may not converge, higher values are more accurate but slower.

data.name: PP_Tol_ToolTip
data.value: Convergence threshold for Gaussian mixture model. Decimal. Recommended 0.1~5. Lower values are more accurate but slower, higher values are faster but less precise.

data.name: PP_GMMMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 2000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_HierarchicalMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum pixel samples for hierarchical clustering. Integer. Recommended 350. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_Linkage_ToolTip
data.value: Linkage method for hierarchical clustering. Single linkage: prone to long chains, noise sensitive; Complete linkage: compact clusters, noise resistant; Average linkage: compromise.

data.name: PP_Distance_ToolTip
data.value: Distance metric for clustering. Euclidean distance: commonly used, suitable for continuous data; Manhattan distance: suitable for discrete data.

data.name: PP_SingleLinkage_ToolTip
data.value: Merges closest clusters each time, prone to long chains, noise sensitive.

data.name: PP_CompleteLinkage_ToolTip
data.value: Merges farthest clusters each time, produces compact clusters, noise resistant.

data.name: PP_AverageLinkage_ToolTip
data.value: Merges clusters with closest average distance each time, compromise solution.

data.name: PP_EuclideanDistance_ToolTip
data.value: Commonly used distance, suitable for continuous data.

data.name: PP_SpectralMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum pixel samples for spectral clustering. Integer. Recommended 2000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_Sigma_ToolTip
data.value: Gaussian kernel σ for spectral clustering. Decimal. Recommended 16~64. Lower values produce finer clustering, higher values produce coarser clustering.

data.name: PP_SpectralKMeansIters_ToolTip
data.value: KMeans iterations after spectral clustering. Integer. Recommended 5~20. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_LabKMeansMaxIterations_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum KMeans iterations. Integer. Recommended 50~200. Lower values may not converge, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_LabKMeansThreshold_ToolTip
data.value: Convergence threshold for clustering. Decimal. Recommended 0.1~5. Lower values are more accurate but slower, higher values are faster but less precise.

data.name: PP_FloydBaseMethod_ToolTip
data.value: Select the algorithm for generating the base palette. Different algorithms affect color distribution and speed.

data.name: PP_FloydDitherStrength_ToolTip
data.value: Dither error diffusion strength. Decimal. Recommended 1.0. Lower values produce weaker dithering, higher values produce stronger dithering, too high may cause excessive noise.

data.name: PP_FloydSerpentine_ToolTip
data.value: When enabled, dithering scan direction alternates each row, reducing stripe artifacts. Recommended to enable.

data.name: PP_FloydKMeansPP_ToolTip
data.value: Better clustering results, slightly slower speed.

data.name: PP_FloydPCA_ToolTip
data.value: Suitable for images with distinct dominant colors.

data.name: PP_OrderedDitherBaseMethod_ToolTip
data.value: Select the algorithm for generating the base palette. Different algorithms affect color distribution and speed.

data.name: PP_OrderedDitherStrength_ToolTip
data.value: Dither error diffusion strength. Decimal. Recommended 1.0. Lower values produce weaker dithering, higher values produce stronger dithering, too high may cause excessive noise.

data.name: PP_MatrixSize_ToolTip
data.value: Size of Bayer matrix. 2x2: large dither grain, 4x4: commonly used, 8x8: fine grain but may lose details.

data.name: PP_Size2x2_ToolTip
data.value: Large grain, suitable for special styles.

data.name: PP_Size4x4_ToolTip
data.value: Commonly used, balances fineness and speed.

data.name: PP_Size8x8_ToolTip
data.value: Fine grain but may lose details.

data.name: PP_OPTICSEpsilon_ToolTip
data.value: Neighborhood radius for OPTICS clustering. Decimal. Recommended 8~64. Lower values produce finer clustering, higher values produce coarser clustering.

data.name: PP_OPTICSMinPts_ToolTip
data.value: Minimum points for OPTICS clustering. Integer. Recommended 3~10. Lower values make it easier to form small clusters, higher values make it harder to form clusters.

data.name: PP_OPTICSMaxSamples_ToolTip
data.value: Maximum number of pixel samples for clustering. Integer. Recommended 2000. Lower values are faster but less accurate, higher values are slower but more accurate.

data.name: PP_BitDepth_ToolTip
data.value: Overrides the color count setting above, generates a fixed bit depth palette. Color count is 2 to the power of bit depth.

data.name: PP_GrayPalette_ToolTip
data.value: Color count is 2 to the power of bit depth, but each color is a grayscale value.
